body_content.explanation: If research is done on people or groups longitudinally, it is done over a long period of time:
examples: Data are from a general population studied longitudinally between the ages of 10 and 36.
Studies that have examined this question longitudinally provide conflicting results.

body_content.explanation: in the long direction of the body, or of any body part:
examples: The colon was opened longitudinally and cleaned with water.
The spread occurs longitudinally and is not visible to the surgeon.

body_content.explanation: in the direction of the longest side of an object:
examples: Slice the narrow end of the aubergine into several round slices, then slice the rest longitudinally.
The rear seat was longitudinally adjustable.
